citeinfo.origin: US Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Water
citeinfo.title: EPA Office of Water (OW): Clean Watersheds Needs Survey NHDPlus Indexed Dataset

descript.abstract: The Clean Watersheds Needs Survey (CWNS) is a comprehensive assessment of the capital needs to the water quality goals set in the Clean Water Act. Every four years, the states and EPA collect information about publicly owned wastewater collection and treatment facilities, storm water and combined sewer overflows control facilities, nonpoint source (NPS) pollution control projects, decentralized wastewater management and estuary management projects. Information collected about these facilities and projects includes estimated needs, including costs and technical information, to address a water quality or water-related public health problems; location and contact information for facilities and projects; facility populations served; flow, effluent, and unit process information and NPS best management practices. This information is used by EPA to document national needs in a report to Congress. The report provides Congress, as well as state legislatures, with information to assist their budgeting efforts. The data is also used to help measure environmental progress, contribute to academic research, provide information to the public and help local and state governments implement water quality programs.
descript.purpose: This dataset contains information on Clean Watersheds Needs Survey events that have been indexed to the National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) Reach Address Database (RAD). The National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) is a database that interconnects and uniquely identifies the millions of stream segments or reaches that comprise the Nations' surface water drainage system. The NHD provides a national framework for assigning reach addresses to water quality related entities. Reach addresses establish the locations of these entities relative to one another within the NHD surface water drainage network. The assignment of reach addresses is accomplished through a process known as reach indexing.
descript.supplinf: This is an EPA-produced data set. Additional information regarding this data set is available at: http://www.epa.gov/cwns/

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness.

horizpa.horizpar: See NHDPlus documentation for information on positional accuracy.

vertacc.vertaccr: See NHDPlus documentation for information on positional accuracy.

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.

citeinfo.origin: US Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Water
citeinfo.title: EPA Office of Water - Clean Watershed Needs Survey Source Dataset

srcinfo.srccontr: 2008 CWNS data extracted from the EPA CWNS system.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (USEPA) and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS).
citeinfo.title: National Hydrography Dataset Plus - NHDPlus

srcinfo.srccontr: NHDPlus v2.1 is the source of all reached indexed events in the EPA Reach Address Database.

procstep.procdesc: Source dataset processed using WATERS Event Indexing Service (http://www.epa.gov/waters/geoservices/docs/event_indexing_service.html).
Record level RAD metadata for indexed results created.
Indexing results returned to CWNS stakeholders for final approval.
Indexed CWNS data loaded into the Reach Address Database (http://www.epa.gov/waters/doc/rad/index.html) using RAD Event Maintenance Procedures.
Final Quality Assurance checks run on all indexed information.

attr.attrdef: 40-char GUID value that uniquely identifies the occurrence of each event.
The date the event was created or updated.

Unique identifier composed of two parts. The first eight digits are the subbasin code defines by FIPS 103, next six digits is a randomly assigned sequential number unique within a Cataloging Unit, length 14.

attrdomv.udom: String value of 14 bytes in length.

attr.attrdef: Date that the reach code was assigned.
Code for source resolution: 1=Local resolution, 2=High resolution, 3=Medium resolution.
40-char GUID value that uniquely identifies the NHD feature upon which the event is located.
Domain value indicating the type of NHD feature the event is associated with.
The organization responsible for the submission of the data. In most cases this is a state abbreviation.

attrdomv.udom: String value no more than 130 bytes in length.

attr.attrdef: Supplemental data relevant to the event.

attrdomv.udom: String value no more than 100 bytes in length.

attr.attrdef: Key field linking the event to source program data.

attrdomv.udom: Codes of varied formats no more than 100 characters in length.

attr.attrdef: Http link leading to online resources with further information about the event.

attrdomv.udom: Http internet link no more than 255 bytes in length.

attr.attrdef: Event display offset
Measure location of the event along the NHD reach.
Domain value indicating the program for which the event has been created.
Abbreviation of US state or state equivalent where the majority of the event is located.

For reached area events, this value is the coefficient of areal correspondence between the event geometry and its parent NHD reach geometry. A value of 1 indicates the area event geometry is equal to the parent reach geometry. The majority of area events in the RAD are equal to the entire parent reach.

attr.attrdef: Count of RAD events having this source feature id.

Initial date the source feature ID was loaded into the reach address database. This represents the date of data processing and has no reflection on the vintage of the events themselves which are expressed through EventDate, Start_Date and Cycle_Year.
Optional date tracking any subsequent updates to the source feature ID.

ID of the authority submitting the source feature ID to the reach address database. This represents the agent doing the indexing and submitting the data through EPA's CDX gateway and does not represent the source of the data which is designated via the Source Originator field.
Total count of all point events participating in the Source Feature ID.
Total length in kilometers of all line events participating in the Source Feature ID.
Total area in square kilometers of all area events participating in the Source Feature ID.
Vendor-required unique numeric key.

distinfo.distliab: No warranty, expressed or implied is made with regard to the accuracy of these data, and no liability is assumed by the U.S. Government in general or the U.S. Census Bureau in specific as to the spatial or attribute accuracy of the data. The act of distribution shall not constitute any such warranty and no responsibility is assumed by the U.S. government in the use of these files. The boundary information in the TIGER/Line Shapefiles is for statistical data collection and tabulation purposes only; their depiction and designation for statistical purposes do not constitute a determination of jurisdictional authority or rights of ownership or entitlement and they are not legal land descriptions.

digtinfo.formcont: These spatial files represent the most up-to-date publicly available Water program data by State or arbitrary region from the Reach Address Database (RAD).

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
